description: An iconic symbol of modern Belarus featuring an eccentric architectural design shaped like a giant diamond (rhombicuboctahedron). Standing 72 meters high with 22 floors, this 2006 building symbolizes the value of knowledge and features spectacular LED lighting that transforms it into a massive color-changing display at night.
highlights: Unique rhombicuboctahedron (diamond) shape - 18 squares and 8 triangles
Designed by Mihail Vinogradov and Viktor Kramarenko
4,646 color-changing LED fixtures creating massive display
Public observation deck at 73 meters altitude
Only structure in Minsk with public observation deck
Sports and recreation complex, cafe, children's playroom
tips: Observation deck open 11:00-23:00 daily, last ascent 22:30
Entry to deck from rear of building (English signs)
Visit at dusk to see LED light show activation
Book guided tours including observation deck visit
Best photographed from distance to capture full structure
vibe: Futuristic, bold, uniquely Belarusian - a dazzling architectural marvel that bridges knowledge and innovation while offering breathtaking city views
